subject: Re: [junit] JUnit precursors
msgSnippet: ... Google smalltalk testing patterns for the article in which Kent describes SUnit. It came first. -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger Diaspar Software Services
messageBody:
Elliotte Harold wrote:
> I'm fact checking for an article I'm writing.
>
> I vaguely recall that when Beck and Gamma invented JUnit on that famous
> transatlantic trip, they were inspired by some preexisting framework in
> SmallTalk. Is that accurate? Does anyone remember what that precursor to
> JUnit was?

Google "smalltalk testing patterns" for the article in which Kent
describes SUnit. It came first.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
